reviews.review: Первое впечатлие от игры положительное! Отличная музыка украшает атмосферу игры. Весело играть с друзьями. Игрок может выбрать класс, который ему больше нравится.

I love Killing Floor

Este juego consiste en partidas solitarias o multijugador online,tipo Cod Zombies,donde vas matando Zombies y van pasando rondas.Los mapas estan normaluchos,aunque hay algunos que molan bastante,como uno que estan en una base espacial,y cuando pegas un escopetazo a un zombie a la vez que saltas,sales volando hacia atras debido al impacto del escopetazo y a la gravedad.Aunque no son Zombies Zombies,son más monstruos.El juego tiene buenos graficos y en la partidas multijugador va muy bien.Ademas,pese a la fecha en que se lanzó el juego,no pide muchos requisitos,y eso es buenisimo,ya que tengo un pc viejo,y en graficos medios me lo corre perfecto.Entre cada ronda hay musica metal que esta perfectamente implementada,ya que reventar cabezas de zombis pegando tiros,y con musica metal a tope de fondo,no me digáis que no mola.También hay  momentos de matrix,donde el tiempo se ralentiza y mola mas reventar a escopetazos la cabeza de un monstruo jaja
Y las armas estan guapisimas,molan mucho.
Lo malo del juego es que no puedes correr,pero no molesta mucho tampoco.
Y tambien que te puede dar muchas horas de juego,pero al final cansa siempre hacer lo mismo y te olvidas del juego.

En definitiva ,una joyita indie,super adictivo,liviano,y con buenos graficos y jugabilidad.Una joyita.

No innova mucho pero....a quien le importa xD

Os lo recomiendo,y mucho.

[h1]You can run, but they'll find you before dawn.[/h1]

As of late, many game developers have gotten so caught-up with making a game artistic, innovative or graphically pleasing that they often lose sight of what's really important in a game: how fun the game is to play. With that being said, let's get the bottom line out of the way: This is a great game.

[i]Killing Floor[/i] is a first-person shooter that pits the player against waves of mutant creatures, each with increasing levels of difficulty. Sound simple? That's because it is. I'm talking about the gameplay mechanics, mind you. Actually playing the game can be quite challenging at times.

This game delivers on many fronts. [b]The graphics are good. Not great, but good.[/b] The gameplay is quick and tons of fun. However, the game can get a little repetitive - It's just the nature of the FPS genre. The multiplayer is a blast, especially with 2-3 of your friends. Although this game does have a 'Solo' mode, don't expect to find a campaign, much less a storyline - you won't find either of those things here.

All-in-all, [i]Killing Floor[/i] is a fun game that you can just pick up and play. There are many great things to be had with this title. If you are contemplating purchasing it, (and you're expecting [i]Call of Duty[/i] style gunplay and quickness), Put your money down now. [i]Killing Floor[/i] will quench your thirst for mutant blood in no time flat.

10/10

I didn't really enjoy the Left 4 Dead games. I hate zombies and the whole zombie craze. I think tower defense games and wave defence games are stupid. However, somehow I can't get enough of this game. 

Maybe it's because it isn't endless wave after wave like the stupid Call of Duty zombies games; there's a definite end goal you're working toward (the Patriarch after the 10th wave in a long game). Maybe it's because of the Counter-strike-ish way you earn money to spend at the end of every "round" (every wave). It's a challenge in its own right to save up for the high-tier weapons every match. Maybe it's because it's a rare game that encourages teamwork and selecting different classes, even on a public server; playing solo or with a team that doesn't help one another is a sure way to get wiped out. Maybe it's because it's extremely well balanced, with no class or weapon being definitively better than the rest. Maybe it's because it has some awesome mods (AKF aliens mod, Shrekriarch, etc.). Maybe it's because the game doesn't take itself too seriously and the devs seem to care about the fans. 

And maybe it's because it's just fun as hell to tear monsters apart with katanas, rocket launchers, and AA-12's.

Kill zombies with yer buddies, what else needs to be said?... More stuff i guess, alright...
Well somehow this game just doesnt get boring, be careful otherwise you will find yourself up at 4am clutching your sweaty mouse and tapping away at the keyboard (which will also be sweaty by now, unless its just me and I'm some kind of sweat monster).

Theres a wide range of zombies and maps, which keeps the game interesting (a lot more interesting then cod zombies at the very least). There is also a range of classes which have unique advantages, and since the game is very team oriented, the class system adds a further level to the team dynamic. For example its useful to have a medic to heal the other players, while a firebug can use flame weapons to deal with a large amount of the zombies, and a support specialist to deal with the zombies up close with shotguns. Working as a team is vital, especially on the harder difficulties.

If you're an achievement maniac, then you will love this game! With over 200 achievements, it'll take you a very long time.

The killing floor community is also a very strong one, with people making new mods/skins/maps all the time. Its very hard to run out of things to do in this game. I got the game for £3.75 and i would definitely recommend you buy it if you see it that cheap, but hey, i would even pay full price for it if i had to (and im a cheap skate, so thats saying something)
I don't even have to talk about the game, it's just really good.

This is a fantastic game. If you don't already have it, do yourself a favor and get it. Each game has 10 rounds of increasing difficulty. When a round ends, you get some time to buy weapons/ammo. You also get to play as a certain perk (berzerker, firebug, etc.) which gives you special abilities/bonuses. As you kill zeds, you earn experience and eventually level up your perk, making the game (somewhat) easier, but not too easy. This game requires loads of team work and decent skill. When you get a good team, nothing beats it. A++

KF2 is on the horizon now and if you aren't excited about that it's cos you haven't played this one.

Great horde mode game, with 6 different classes that give you different bonus for weapons, grenades and armor, around 70 weapons, some sold trough dlc, that is cheap, but you alread have a good selection even without it, around 60 weapons.

A mod community full of different maps, monster, character skins and weapons, and also with holyday events changing the appearence of the monsters.

It's repetitive and it takes a long time to lvl up the classes to max level, but it's tons of fun, and if you don't have the patience to lvl up the classes, you can get a save of another person to put yourself in max level.

Also, the game was made to be only coop, but there's alread mods to play pvp.

This is by far my favorite game. The options are great for weapons, the maps are detailed and it's hella fun. Challenging enough to not get bored but still beatable. I have 5 other games I really want to play but I can't stop playing Killing Floor to try them out. So excited for KF2 to come out!!
Vale mto a pena comprar esse game

I like Killing Floor because of how remarkable simple it is: survive waves of zombies progressively getting harder and harder until the final wave where you fight the boss. The gameplay is nice since there are so many unique ways of killing these zombies ranging from burning them to using a rocket launcher. 

The addition of perks too makes the game that much more enjoyable. Every team member specializes in a certain field of expertise such as an explosions expert to a firebug who uses only the flamethrower. This is fun and all, but perhaps my one dislike of the game is that it is sort of a grind to level up your perks. I bought this game expecting to just jump in and shoot every zombie without thinking, "Oh just 5,000 more headshots and I'll make it to level three!"

All that being said, I highly recommend this game for anyone who wants a fun, gory, zombie survival game.

this game is old, but epic. with a whole lotta epicness. Besides the fact that it has become built upon DLC. Maybe a year ago-I didnt have it then- it would have been better because it was before the update which put that in. Other than that, it's a rock solid game with amazing gameplay

This game is very fun if you enjoy co-op FPS shooters! The community is fantastic which is a huge place, the developers maps are amazing and the custom maps are sometimes even more amazing or just plain funny. The classes are all enjoyable to play, but it's no problem to just stick to your favourites. For a game from 2009 it doesn't feel that old. I know KF2 is coming out soon (and looks amazing) but I hope Killing Floor continues to have a strong online community.

While this is a fun game, there are a few negatives: -It feels kind of like a beta more than a finished game. -It can get repetitive really quickly. -The Workshop system is beyond broken for the game. Seriously, Workshop items will rarely download or work. Now for the positives. +It is insanely fun with other people and even in single player. +There are plenty of guns and classes available +There's nothing like the fear of a Fleshpound charging you on a higher difficulty with only dual pistols. I would recommend it, but FIX THE F**KING WORKSHOP SYSTEM!! It works better on L4D2! P.S. Do NOT buy any of the DLC for the game, it is already in the game. If you use the console you can see that the DLC guns are already in the game and are usable.
